mainHero.subtitle: for young and old
mainHero.additionalText: Through activities to independence in everyday life.
mainHero.description: Occupational therapy is a client-centered profession focused on promoting health and well-being through activities. The primary goal of occupational therapy is to enable people to participate in everyday activities.

items.title: What is occupational therapy?
items.description:
Occupational therapy is a healthcare profession, and an occupational therapist is a healthcare worker who encourages individuals to engage in meaningful everyday activities. It focuses on improving or maintaining health in terms of bodily functions and structures as well as mental health. Our common goals will be to carry out activities to promote health, well-being, and the most successful performance of prioritized activities. The occupational therapist is also here to offer components for performing activities in the areas of:
performing Basic Daily Activities, such as washing, dressing, and eating, as well as Extended Daily Activities,
environmental assessment, fall prevention, and advice on home adaptations for greater safety
advice on the use of orthotic and medical technical aids
returning to everyday life: to school, work, and other leisure hobbies,
training family members
information about assistive technology that can help the individual achieve independence.

The occupational therapy process usually includes:
Individual assessment, where we will ask about your wishes, interests, history, and treatment after musculoskeletal injury or nervous system disease.
Development of a [re]habilitation plan to help you achieve set goals.
Occupational therapy sessions (the number of sessions is agreed upon according to the individual's condition and wishes).

elderlyHero.subtitle: for older adults
elderlyHero.description: We fully experience life through the things we love doing every day – in kindergarten or school, at work, at home, or in communities. Occupational therapy is a healthcare profession that helps you or your family member develop the skills needed for daily activities when these abilities are reduced or lost due to injury, (chronic) illness, mental health challenges, developmental delay, learning difficulties, the effects of aging, or other health factors.

features.title: Don't miss ...
features.subtitle: Benefits of occupational therapy
features.description: Occupational therapy brings many benefits to your health and quality of life. With an individually tailored approach, we help you achieve greater independence in everyday activities, improve physical and mental well-being, and actively participate in society. Discover the key benefits that occupational therapy can bring to your life.

items.name: Neuro-muscular taping
items.description: A technique through which we influence the musculoskeletal, vascular, lymphatic, and neurological systems. We use (de)compressive stimuli by applying a self-adhesive elastic tape for natural body healing.

items.name: Montessori approach
items.description: When working with people with dementia, it is crucial not to forget the person behind the diagnosis. Instead of focusing on limitations, we look for their abilities, interests, and unique life stories. Respecting their background, culture, and needs allows for the creation of an environment that encourages independence and meaningful involvement. The Montessori approach for dementia, disability, and aging is based on four fundamental principles that strengthen self-esteem, enable choice, and encourage contribution to the community.

items.name: More activities
items.description: Occupational therapy helps you re-establish a routine of daily activities and enables you to return to your favorite activities. Learn new ways of performing activities and discover new interests.

items.name: More independence
items.description: With the help of occupational therapy, you can achieve greater independence in daily tasks. Learn new strategies and use aids that make activities easier and reduce dependence on others.
